Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, reasonable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: pinktinks81 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a hen party of 14. Basic rooms which were quite small but adequate as a base. Service was very good-extra blankets when required, clean towels when requested. Allowed guests to change rooms for their own reasons. For example, someone who needed a ground floor room was moved to the ground floor. Staff were helpful with providing information on how to get to various attractions, booking taxis and looking up informtion on the internet and making enquiries over the telephone. Location was good-near enough to the centre, 15 minutes from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: maggie m
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel, pretty basic but comfortable enough as a base...clean sheets and towels, friendly staff, reasonably central location, dreadful breakfast, especially if u are a vegetarian, with no cereal or toast, just bread...extra pillows would be helpful as only two very flat ones were on the bed and an extra blanket or bedspread would have been nice too, having said that, the room was warm as the heating was on and it was nice and quiet so no problem with a good nights sleep...the en suite had a dreadful smell (room 24), and the climb up the many flights of stairs a bit of a challenge!...

Reviews.Title: “You can find better places for the same amount of money”
Reviews.Author: allana_garcez
Reviews.Content: I stayed one weekend in this hotel and I do not recommend to anyone. It is a walking distance from Amsterdam Central station, but I saw many other hotels around the area that look much better. The room is very small and does not have window. The wireless internet does not work in the room, just in the lobby. Poor quality towels were provided. The breakfast was very simple. And the price was expensive taking into account what is being offered.

Reviews.Title: “Stag Weekend”
Reviews.Author: a b
Reviews.Content: It was what we expected we had a six bed appartment which served us well for what we wanted, it was clean enough the beds were pretty comfy its not the ritz ut for a stag do it is good because you have your own entrance so can come and go as you please with out having to see anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good all round.”
Reviews.Author: stephne c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: found the hotel easily from centraal station. we had a pleasant welcome to the hotel. throughout our stay we received a good breakfast and good all round service from the hotel staff. the hotel room was basic, but more than adequate for our three night stay. we quickly got our bearings from the hotel and found the location very conveinient.

Reviews.Title: “sub-basement blues”
Reviews.Author: chris c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother for a week over new years. First off the so called room was more like a sub basement, or storage room converted into a room. I was at least expecting a standard hotel room, very disappointing. Believe it or not it could have been worse as we noticed they had basement rooms with no windows. At least we had windows in our storage room. There was no plug for the sink and when I asked for one, I was told there were none in the hotel. How strange. Within an hour of arriving at our room the lady from the reception came banging on our door and more or less accused us of tampering with the smoke alarm, we did no such thing. She tried to make out that their smoke alarms are somehow monitored and ours was being tampered with. I can only imagine this was some sort of scare tactic to stop people smoking in their rooms, which as non-smokers, we had not intention of doing. And the place stunk of weed anyway, so I'm not sure what she was trying to achieve. The only good thing about this hotel was it's location. It's located near central station and it's quite easy to walk to all the different districts from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Crackin weekend”
Reviews.Author: r_evs712
Reviews.Content: Great place. Great location. Comfy rooms. On the corner of Rembrandt square. Clubs and bars a ahort walk. Get what you pay for. Accomodated 5 loud lads well. Would recommend or use again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location - close to Central Station and Dam Square. The hotel is clean but basic. The staircase up to the rooms is very steep and there's no lift so not suitable for people with limited mobility. We paid about Â£250 for 3 nights, which was cheap compared to many other hotels. We arrived a few hours before check-in but the staff were very friendly and held our bags while we went out to explore, when we returned the room was ready as promised. Breakfast was ham, cheese, bread & a boiled egg - not the most exciting but pleasant enough! I would recommend for a basic place to get some rest, but nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: RajBirmingham
Reviews.Content: The woman at reception is SO rude! she had a bad attitude and was really unhelpful! The location is good, however not the cleanest of places

Reviews.Title: “okay, not super clean”
Reviews.Author: Eden K
Reviews.Content: Okay for a budget hotel, but the sheets were not very clean and the blanket had holes in it. A bug crawled out of the sheets before I went to sleep - it was too big to be a bedbug so I didn't care too much.The bathroom was clean. The place smelled like smoke but my room did not. Breakfast was included and was okay.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful but dont expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: Belliiiiita
Reviews.Content: we stayed in an apartment for 6 people. * good- location, very central , close to the clubs ,bars , cofee shops, shopping, spacios, nice furniture, nicely decorated rooms * bad- extremely noice at night as the bars are downstairs and music is so loud its imposible to sleep, late check in , no mirrows (1 little mirrow in bathroom and very little mirrow in the living room ) ,

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetmanuk
Reviews.Content: I had read quite a few negative reviews on this hotel and I admit I was expecting the worst. I was pleasantly surprised though. This was located within easy walking distance to Central Station and all the other "attractions" the city has to offer. I paid 35 Euros for the night, this was for a twin room sharing and a breakfast of bread, the smallest boiled egg I have ever seen and a couple of slices of ham and cheese. Not brilliant, but very welcome after a heavy nights drinking. The room was a tad smelly, but I told the guy on reception and it was sorted by the time we got back. It was clean and comfortable, the bathroom suite looked new and the room felt safe. I would use it again for a trip with my mates and would recommend for a budget stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Ok”
Reviews.Author: Zadig_PL
Reviews.Content: Terrible localization, good breakfast, clean room, I would go back there. The hostel is near the railways station and the center (7-8 minutes by foot).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeRuby_roo
Reviews.Content: This place was the worst I have ever stayed in. It was nothing like the pictures on the booking site. No lift which was not surprising but when you climbed the three or four flights of stairs you expected a decent room. WRONG smelly, dirty carpets, curtains hanging off the windows, door handles to the basic bathroom broken and in one room sink broken so no water stayed in it. Smoke alarm was covered over by a sock. No fire escape so because of this I would certainly NOT take my children there. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: chrishelben
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dire. The carpets were filthy, the shower cubicle constantly fell apart. The sheets were clean and the towels were clean. Breakfast was not good, boiled eggs probably cooked once a week and then kept for several days. Staff were smoking in the kitchen. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a base close by all attractions”
Reviews.Author: michbv
Reviews.Content: Obviously for a 2 star hotel it was basic, but perfect for what we were after. A family with 3 children aged 7, 11, and 12. We booked a room for 5 people and got a type of apartment! As the twin beds were in a separate room to the 3 childrens beds. The childrens beds were up some very steep stairs ( well it is Amsterdam!) but they were good age to cope with this. Bathroom was clean, bedding was clean. Only 5 minute walk from station. We hired bikes from Mikes bikes, which we had done in the past. VERY friendly company. Excellent tours.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: mic_starcross
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quadruple room which can fit 5 people, there are 3 single beds and a double bed. It is pretty basic - clean pillows, bedsheets, blankets and towels. Shampoo, soap and hairdryer was not provided though. However, in order to get to our room we have to climb through 3 flights of stairs to get to the top floor. The hotel interior was pretty old and needs refurbishment. Breakfast was simple with bread (not toasted!), a boiled egg, slices of ham and cheese, jams, butter and tea/coffee. The location was very good, just a few minutes' walk to Amsterdam Centraal station and close to Dam square and red light district. The staff were helpful and let us store our luggage in a store room before our check-in and after check-out. The hotel operates a 24-hour reception system so we were always allowed in on late nights (no curfew!). Overall, its relatively basic and simple. Would have liked it more if its cheaper as its a similar experience staying in a hostel (except City Hotel is more expensive!).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value, nice staff, first class location”
Reviews.Author: drewedmin999
Reviews.Content: OK, this hotel is very basic, and if you want to find faults then you don't have to look very hard for them. However it is clean, the staff are nice, it is very very cheap, and the location is ideal, a 2 minute walk from the station, far enough away to be quiet but you still have all the attractions on your doorstep. I took a 2 year old, 9 year old and 13 year old and it felt very safe and omfortable. If your idea of a hotel in Amsterdam is a clean base to explore the city, which doesnt cost very much so you can spend your money on the attractions then stay here. If you expect anything more than a basic hotel however then spend more money. I gave this hotel a 5 not because it is faultless, there are lots of faults, but because it met my expectations in every way. I knew what I had paid for and i got it.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kikka777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic but that is reflected in the price. the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. our room was at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet. we had our own bathroom in the room, not very common in amsterdam, which was clean with a great shower. the hotel staff were very helpful and welcoming and let us leave our bags there after checking out beacuse our plane back was later in the day. breakfast was included and it was basic but good. overall, great value for money especially with the included breakfast and own bathroom. beware of the very steep stairs but i think these are very common everywhere in amsterdam! The main negative point is the room decor, very '70s' but not in a good way!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheep and chearfull”
Reviews.Author: MichaelS234
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if your just lookin for a place to sleep and shower. Clean rooms but in 1970s style Great staff very helpful Great location 5 min walk to station,10 min to red light district .and a great smoker friendly cafe just 2 min walk from hotel Hotel is also smoker friendly Will def be going back in the new year 10 out 10 for the price you paying can't compliane

Reviews.Title: “ugliest hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: neva08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this week for two nights with my husband...we'd booked it thinking it would be really pretty and traditional, as the website gives you that impression. However, I almost cried when I got there. The decor is like something from beyond the iron curtain from the 70s....it is in a shockingly bad state. The staff are curteous but totally uninterested in giving advice (we asked them to rate the Chinese restaurant ACROSS THE ROAD...they said they didn't know it. Again we asked how to get from the hotel to the Jordaan district...they didn't know!). The rooms were ugly and in a terrible decorative state. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: swisstony2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Good points ; location , only short walk to central station and red lights. maids kept room tidy. 24hr reception. Bad points ; single room was more like a wardrobe in size , room smelt badly of sewers/drains. Reported it to staff member who just shook his head as if in disbelief. Breakfast ,Asked for my bread to be toasted but was told we dont do toast here ?. Overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect much, and was very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: WillC123
Reviews.Content: Great location, but I didn't expect much for my 100 EU in this part of Amsterdam. Should have run when I found they had lost my reservation. The guy who didn't get a room later that night owes me big time. I got the room above the reception area (A1). Small (as expected) and the linens seemed to be clean (good!), but the smell was a bit off, and I could just barely walk around the room standing at a shade under 6'. Blankets and carpet appeared to be from the 70s, and while I think they make an honest effort to keep them clean, at some point one must give up (probably in the 80s). The window looks out onto a trash covered interior roof, but I could close it, if not lock, and the curtains (put in with the carpet) hid that from view. At that point, I wouldn't return, but I could live with it for a night. Then I settled in for the night, and it got bad. The double bed was simply to soft and saggy to sleep in (and the covers were a bit scary), but the single was in better shape, and fewer hiding places. I watched the tiny TV for a few minutes until in conked out, then went to sleep. It was quiet, I will credit them that. In the morning I found that the shower did not work AT ALL, and I assume from the lack of soap in the soap dispenser that it hadn't for a while. I had to bend over to stand in front of the tiny sink (probably a 5'8" height limit for this bathroom), and my shower from the sink turned into a very memorable experience. Obviously, I splashed some water around the 2'x4' bathroom floor, which made it very hard to keep from stepping out onto the carpet with wet feet (I could stand it with dry, but not sure what wet feet would pick up). I had the 'breakfast' of industrial bread (5 slices white and 1 of wheat!), 2 slices of meat, 2 cheese, and a small glass of orange juice (with personal service, you couldn't go back for more and I didn't ask). After my 'shower', I was getting late at checkout, and there was someone in front complaining about some problem, I handed over the key and left. This is a beautiful old building, and they might have some nice rooms, but this was totally inexcusable as a full price hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was a good place”
Reviews.Author: Dutchbikes
Reviews.Content: Was there for the weekend. Nice people and all was good and clean. Had some places to cgo and they helped me on the way. Took a good deal from booking.com and all went smooth. Would use the hotel again as now i know how to go around...........

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulreith
Reviews.Content: stayed in the city hotel with 6 friends and family for 2 nights 20-22 feb 2010. second time we have stayed in the city. rooms are basic but clean and of different sizes. our double room was on the small side. location is very good, about 10 minutes walk from central station and the red light district. staff are so friendly and helpful,a special thankyou to Ossie.we will be back in amsterdam later this year or early next year and will stay in the city hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Amsterdam hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: LOLANetherlands
Reviews.Content: Went there in June 2008 for a spontaneous break(we live in NL),cost 90 euros excl.city tax for 1 double on a Friday night,not that bad regarding I booked last minute and Amsterdam is extorsion overall! The room was small but clean, we got the one behind the bar, the noise level wasnt bad. The TV is ancient and all furniture are more than basic.Fantastic view on the wall from the window. But the location is fantastic, 5 mins from everything including CS. Perfect if you need a place to crash but its no place to chill.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price!”
Reviews.Author: M0rgan888
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a couple of weeks. The location is brilliant. Close to CS but aside from major walking streets - no crowds of beople in front of the hotel. The room was tiny! No elevator, Dutch stairs.... not for disabled and overweighted. The room was tidy but everything inside seemed to be from 80s XX. The was an electric kettle. There was a cupboard with mini-fridge or mini-bar but I could not understand how to open it. They use energy-efficient lamps but they switched on for about 3 minutes. There was very few natural light in the room as the tiny room was facing tiny backyard. Breakfasts... always the same limited choice. A perfect place to sleep and leave early in the morning and go back only in the evening. PROs summary: perfect location, perfect price, nice staff/owners CONs summary: tiny rooms, no elevator, old furniture and textile

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: paulsm68
Reviews.Content: stayed at the city hotel with 5 mates hotel over lookin the main canal 5 mins walk from the train station that goes direct to the airport 5 mins walk from the bars and restraunts and (red light ) a good ten min walk to dam square in all a good place too stay in reach of everything you need

Reviews.Title: “There is no worse place, than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2519
Reviews.Content: I am doing business travel for the last 20 years, but this hotel was the worst I stayed in my private and business time. The room was dirty, the WC and shower smelled awful, the room not clean, MoskitoÂ´s all night, loud neighbours, windows with gap which does not close, high prices and no cancelations policy for obvious reasons. DONT GO THERE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place ever been to”
Reviews.Author: xxxnice_guyxxx
Reviews.Content: Arrived there on a Saturday for 3 Nights. Since the company booked I couldnÂ´t change the place. Just imagine a really dirty and 30 year old youth hostel with no service and the city hotel amsterdam is even worse. The bathroom was full of hair from some people living there before. The bed wasnÂ´t made during my stay and the room not cleaned, no towels changed. Just no service at all. The whole room is dirty, you donÂ´t want to know what kind of animals live in the well hung-out beds or rest in the ancient carpet. You do not want to touch the ground barefooted. The breakfast ist toast but not tasted with an egg as hard as a baseball and nasty jam. Overall all of my colleagues made the same or even worse experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: SusJoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, close to the train station and not far from sites, shopping, the flower market and the Red Light district. The room was a decent size although the bathroom was small. We were in the back of the building so noise was not an issue. There were cigarette burns in the chairs, carpet and bedspread. Breakfast consisted of a soft-boiled egg, a few slices of lunchmeat and cheese, bread (no toast), coffee or tea. Not a bad way to start the day, but not a full meal. Staff was very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good low budget hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dadio77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position, a few minutes walk from Dam Square, but far enough out from the seedy parts of the city! As is typical in most Amsterdam hotels, the service is very good, but the rooms, reached by way of very very steep stairs, are very basic indeed - great for a stag do or footy match, but not to take loved ones or kids!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple. Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: SC_Sixx
Reviews.Content: Great location near Central Station and trams. Rooms are small and sparse but functional. This place is definitely only for people that are in Amsterdam on a budget and only need a bed to sleep in and a shower to bathe in. Staff were friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “If you're lookig for romantic, or family stay I say: NO! ...but if you feel pary... this is your place!”
Reviews.Author: Kuzmin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a 3 bad room. Ther room was on the 3rd floor. No elevator. The stairs was extreamly high. I do not recomend it for old pepole. It was a nightmair to climb there. The room was very basic, poor...but clean. It was fine for what we targeted. Only for sleeping. We had a berakfast. It was wery basic. Two slice of Bread, butter, jam, ham + coffe. On the other hand: Pubs, Coffeshop, Red lamp district, Bike rential, Central Railway Station is about two minutes on foot. If you go here with family or you looking for romantic I say: NO, but if you feel pary...and this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “don't even try”
Reviews.Author: kizooo
Reviews.Content: very bad hotel, poor rooms, poor reception, poor restaurant, noisy , so small rooms. although i reserved a room 2 weeks before i reach the hotel they gave me a room in the basement beside the stairs. i was able to hear every single voice out of the room . the room was so small, the beds and carpets and the bath were poor. the location is near to the cntral station but ii is not near to several locations. you need to take the tram or you'll walk about 30 minutes to reach a plave like rembrandt plein and 15 miutes to reach dam square. the staff were cool and helpful but that's the only thing that can be considered good in this place.

Reviews.Title: “grew on you”
Reviews.Author: dundeegal
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed in a quad room - 4 beds and a single wardrobe!! we had to live out the suitcase. view was non existant, no mirror in the living area and the drains smelled awful. Having said that the bed was cosy and comfy, breakfast was excellent, the staff very friendly and helful and we were 5 mins from central station one way and the red light district the other. beautiful city - would go back in a flash but beware - very VERY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: GeeCee62
Reviews.Content: It took me an hour from leaving the plane untiI arrival at the hotel. Quick baggage collection, train into Amsterdam and a short walk to the hotel. Close to everything from the RLD to transport to cultural activities and food/ drink.The room was small, but well appointed, staff friendly and breakfast was yum. 24hour reception as well.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a night when you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: PlasticCastle
Reviews.Content: I only stayed the one night as I was in town for a concert. It is situated near the central station and it takes about 10 minutes to walk from there to the hotel. I had a single room which was clean but very small and quite shabby. I didn't spend much time here as it was just a place to rest after my concert and I checked out early in the morning. To be honest, when returning to Amsterdam and staying longer, I would not stay here. Not that there's anything wrong with the City Hostel. I think you can find a more comfartable hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “quite good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lycheeinsel
Reviews.Content: We, a young couple from Austria, visited Belgium and the Netherlands in Sept./Oct this year. As we stayed in a terrible 3-star hotel in Brussels we we're not looking forward staying in this 2-star hotel in Amsterdam. But we were proofen wrong and get a quiet, really cosy room in this hotel located near the railway station. You need about 10min to the city center by foot. We cannot share the experiences of the other travelers we read here. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was indeed a bit small but there was a window and a nice view, comfy beds and we got every day a new towel. Travelers with big suitcases may have some difficulty to reach the upper floors. We were lucky to get a room on the first floor and had only to climb one steep staircase. The hotel is smoke-free since this summer. We can recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a small budget and spends most of the time sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: DouglasEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Two couples,in their 60's,simply wanting a short three day break were allocated to this hotel.Read the reviews and were quite fearful,arrived and allocated rooms 1A and 2A.Rooms were quite small and 2A has a weird shaped bath and shower,not too easy to get out if you were short or unfit,but the beds and bedding were clean and fresh towels each day.A short walk from the Station and into the Centre after the usual continental breakfast with very good fresh coffee.Good English and directions if needed from Reception.Overall impression-yes I would use again but it is not the Ritz so don't expect that .

Reviews.Title: “dont panic about bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: gildizzle
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day stay in the Dam, ten of us (mainly students) went for a friend's birthday. Obviously we were looking for quite cheap accomodation, so we decided on City Hotel Amsterdam, as it could fit us all in, and was cheap considering its location. i always check trip advisor whenever i have a trip booked, and so we were surprised (but largely amused) to hear our hotel was hated by many visitors, and some of the horror stories were terrible! i felt apprehensive about our stay, we didn't care too much, we only needed a place to crash, but still, it makes you panic that you're about to stay in a filth-ridden faulty towers. I have to say, having been, most of the negative reviews seem a bit exaggerated....City Hotel Amsterdam managed to exceed our expectations and gave us 3 nights of secure, comfortable accomodation with friendly staff and a fantastic location. Its fair to say that the decor isn't modern, but it isn't falling to pieces or anything, and its also kept very clean. We'd booked 4 rooms - a quad, 2 doubles and a twin. The quad was fantastic, i expected the room to be tiny and cramped - but it was a brillaint size, with four single beds, a small ensuite and lots of floor space. The twin room was also surprisingly big, and even had some kind of jacuzzi-bath get up! (we never tried, but i think at least 4 people would have fit in ha ha). The doubles were slightly different. The room me and my boyfriend stayed in was lovely, good size, nice bathroom - but my two other friends stayed in the box room that previous reviews have talked about. Yes the room was small, but not ridiculously small - there was still room for a decent ensuite, closet space and a desk. my friends were perfectly happy, and overall all the rooms were clean when we arrived, were cleaned daily and the towels changed. the only thing i'd say was missing from the rooms was perhaps a safe facility - we hid our money but i wasn't comfortable without somewhere secure to keep things. On the last day i noticed one of my perfumes was missing - luckily it wasn't an expensive one, but it was nowhere to be found in the room or either of our cases when we returned home and so now we feel it may have been taken. i only made it to breakfast once, but again this was good value for money - simple (eggs, bread, ham, cheese, tea/coffee and orange juice) but fine as a quick bite to eat before you start your day. the staff were also great - very friendly, spoke great english, and were happy to help whenever we needed anything. we left our keys behind whenever we went out to avoid losing them - and whenever we returned, even at 3am, there was always someone waiting at reception to let us in and return the keys. we used to luggage store on both the day we arrvied and on our last day, and again staff were very willing to help out. the location of the hotel is also good, 10 minutes walk from the centre, damrak and the rld, 5 mins to the train station, but also on a quiet street for undisturbed sleep. all we needed from our accomodation was a place to sleep, shower and get changed in. you're in amsterdam - why would you stay in your hotel!? so for our needs, the hotel was great - cheap, clean, friendly staff and breakfast included. if you're looking for a romantic getaway, obviously you'd want to focus more on the accomodation - but for a stag night, or birthday trip like ours, city hotel amsterdam is great. cheep and cheerful!! we all came back from our trip perfectly happy with the hotel, and i would definately reccomended. p.s. the stairs of death live up to their reputation!!! they're so steep its actually hilarious. but you'll soon learn that a lot of dutch stairs are exactly the same!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Gutterheart
Reviews.Content: After booking the hotel we read the reviews on tripadvisor - usually our hotel Bible BEFORE we book! I must admit we were worried. However, we were pleasantly surprised when we got there. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. Rooms were basic but clean - I'm not sure what people expect from a 2star hotel, but if you want the Ritz then pay Ritz prices! Breakfast was Dutch - bread, eggs, ham, cheese. Location about 5 minutes walk from Centraal station and the same to the RLD - perfect for seeing the sights. Not a 5star AI but a great place to crash if you just want a bed, shower and breakfast. We're going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful on Prins Hendrikkade”
Reviews.Author: butch_wade
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a triple room, with two mates. A fourth member of the party had his own room. We had to ascend the staircase of death to get to the room. Dutch staircases are not for the faint hearted or clumsy! 3 floors later, we arrived at door 11A. When we opened the door, we were confronted with more stairs! This led through a hatch into the roof of the building, where our 3 single beds were waiting. Unlike earlier reviews, the room, sheets and towels were clean. The only problem was the heat on the first afternoon. Some thoughtful previous occupants had left us a gift of two pork pies in the fridge, and some chocolate based snacks were found in a cupboard. The breakfast was ok, no problems there. n.b. I'm NOT refferring to the previously mentioned pork pies, we decided to give those a miss! The reception staff were reasonably friendly and helpful, offering to change our reservations, as one of our party had not been able to join us. The hotel is a budget hotel, and on that basis, we couldn't find anything to complain about, cheap and cheerful really does apply to this place. It's convenient for Centraal Station, and only a few minutes walk to the bars of the RLD. I would never ever dream of staying here with my wife, but for a blokes weekend away, it was ideal, and I'm sure that we will consider it for our next 'jolly boys outing' to the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly different”
Reviews.Author: Ramster65
Reviews.Content: We were four blokes on a weekender, not looking for anything great just clean and comfortable. On entering reception, my first impression was that the hotel was in need of a little TLC but nothing major. This obviously wasn't a multi-national chain hotel. I shared a triple with two others while our fourth member had a double to himself. We were on the third floor, so up we went. No surprises with the first flight but flights two and three were the steepest stairs I have ever seen. They also curled around a corner and had very shallow steps which made coming down quite interesting. When we finally made the third floor our key didn't fit room 11 but there was a door marked 11A so we tried that. On opening the door we were greeted with another flight of stairs to what amounted to a loft conversion. Climbing this short staircase brought us up through a hatch into a loft which was as hot as hell. What we had was the strangest, most old fashioned and basic room I had ever paid to stay in and to be honest I wasn't very impressed. However the beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean, though mine did have old stains which hadn't washed out properly. The cross beams were a little low and were about as high as the bridge of my nose (though I am 6ft4) and the bathroom door was even lower, about shoulder high. Night time trips to the toilet were challenging and could be made slightly more so by not closing the hatch to the stairs. Had I known what it was like before I went I wouldn't have gone but actually it grew on me and the climb became something of a joke between us. It is worth bearing in mind however that if there had been a fire, there is no alternative exit from the loft. Breakfast was the usual cheese, ham, fruit juice etc. and reasonable really.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: johndon
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel i ever stayed in it was filthy they would not return our money do not recomend this so called hotel photos are available will send on reqest

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: Windalicka
Reviews.Content: Booked this place cos it was cheap. Room was very small, but clean with dated furniture and decor, very basic to say the least. Situated at the back of the Hotel, so overlooked windows and walls. Lots of noisy leaking guttering and drain pipes outside my window made for a disturbed nights sleep. Good location though, close to Centraal Station and the Red Light Area. Staff were helpful and friendly and breakfast was OK. I suppose at the end of the day, 'You get what you pay for'

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: reggiewac
Reviews.Content: We booked four different rooms, which were all dirty. Nobody had a warm shower, which were filthy anyway. My room had a steaming [---] in the toilet when we arrived. One room had the door kicked down and possesions stolen. Unfriendly staff. Please, please steer clear of this hotel. I am going to.

HotelInfo.Name: City Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Prins Hendrikkade 130, Amsterdam 1011 AP, The Netherlands
